description.narrative: Nutrition/ECD/Early Stimulation/WASH needs assessments and response implementation, which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Adolescent Health And Nutrition (Covid), Environmental Sustainability, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2021, the most vulnerable children and their families affected by crises have received timely and effective assistance those in post-crisis situations benefited from improved and equitable access to social services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Nutrition/ECD/Early Stimulation/WASH needs assessments and response implementation

description.narrative: In 2019 UNICEF reached 4,540 people (50:50 male/female) of which 1,106 are migrants (including 442 children) in communities hosting migrants from Venezuela with safe drinking water and sanitation, sustained IYCF outreach for the care givers of 2530 children, provided ECD outreach for 947 children from 0 to 5, and facilitated 2 multi agency field assessments led by the Civil Defence Commission to host communities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/01/2020
